channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report X-2024021007
item.description:
Report X-2024021007

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED PACKAGE NOTICEABLY WET DUE TO INTERNAL LEAKAGE OF CONTENTS. 2 X 5 LITERS (OXIDIZER, CORROSIVE LIQUIDS) FAILED ENTIRELY DUE TO LOOSEN BOTTLE CAPS. DAMAGED AND UNUSABLE GOODS. DescribePack: FAILED AT TOP BOTTLE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.

item.title: Report E-2024020407
item.description:
Report E-2024020407

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-19
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Material was shipped as a non-regulated shipment of petroleum distillates. Once received the material was analyzed by our lab and the flash point of the material was determined to be 138F. The material was determined to be a hazardous waste UN 1268 Petroleum Distillates with a waste code of D001 for ignitibility. The material did ship on a hazardous waste manifest (MT# 0206124145JJK). To rectify the situation, we updated the shipping description and waste codes on the hazardous waste manifest. We relabeled the drums with hazardous waste labels and are managing the waste as hazardous.

item.title: Report E-2024020321
item.description:
Report E-2024020321

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-07
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When employees went to attach hoses to bottom connection and they undid the cap for the bottom valve about a quart of liquid came out. The tanker was in containment and no material went off site. The spill was able to be cleaned in house. It was discovered that the internal valve wasn't fully closed and that was the cause of the leak. The trailer was then sent to be inspected also before use again.

Report X-2024020542

  • City: BOURBON
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE LOADER ON THE BELT WENT TO PICK UP THE PACKAGE AND NOTICED IT WAS LEAKING. EMPLOYEE STOPPED THE BELT AND NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED THE RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER PUT ON PPE AND RESPONDED TO THE PACKAGE USING DECISION TREE. THE REPSONDER THEN TRANSFERED THE HAZMAT OVER TO THE HAZMAT AREA.

item.title: Report X-2024020165
item.description:
Report X-2024020165

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-02
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: An undeclared shipment was discovered at the INDH facility during sort operations. The fiberboard box came down a slide and split open reveling the contents. The spill agent observed two 1L plastic bottle containing UN1987 inside. One bottle the cap had come off spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box the other was undamaged. The outer packaging did not have any of the DG markings or paperwork needed for transport. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and are being held at the location.

item.title: Report X-2024020652
item.description:
Report X-2024020652

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-25
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED PACKAGE NOTICEABLY WET DUE TO INTERNAL LEAKAGE. PACKAGE DEEMED PUNCTURED, CAUSING AN INTERNAL LEAKAGE OF INTERNAL CONTENTS. 1 OF 6 CARTRIDGES FAILED, BUT ENTIRE PACKAGES STAINED AND SOILED. CONTENTS DEEMED AS PRINTING INK UN1210. 6 CARTRIDGES X 4.5 LITERS TOTAL. DescribePack: FAILED AT BODY OF CARTRIDGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.

item.title: Report X-2024020455
item.description:
Report X-2024020455

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package contains four 1-gallon metal cans of Klean Strip denatured alcohol fuel. Although no apparent damage to outer box other than stain from spilled liquid, each can was dented to some extent during transit from some unknown event and liquid had leaked out of can and through box. Amount of spilt liquid did not appear great. Most of liquid evaporated upon leaking from can. Package was placed in damaged hazmat tote. No other PPE used. DescribePack: Cans were dented, included one at the cap on top. Liquid appeared to have leaked from this can at the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in damaged hazmat tote and taken to damage area for processing.

item.title: Report X-2024020569
item.description:
Report X-2024020569

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-26
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: HAZMAT RESPONDER CALLED TO METRO 2 FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE WITH A STRONG ODOR. UPON ARRIVAL WEARING HAZMAT PPE, CHECKED THE PH LEVEL AND FOLLOWED THE RESPONDER'S DECISION TREE. PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE FOR TRANSPORT BACK THE HAZMAT CAGE. FURTHER INSPECTION OF THE PACKAGE LABEL (INGREDIENTS LISTED, "FLAMMABLE", ODOR), LACKING SHIPPING PAPERS, UNABLE TO PULL AN SDS OR COMPANY INFO - DETEREMINED THIS IS A POTENTIAL UNDECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE. CONTATCTED THE HAZMAT HELP DESK TO REPORT AND VERIFY.

item.title: Report X-2024020517

Report X-2024020517

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED PACKAGE NOTICEABLY WET DUE TO INTERNAL LEAKAGE OF CONTENTS. CONTENTS DEEMED AS 1 X 5 US GALLONS: STEEL PAIL OF UN1263 (FLAMMABLE LIQUID). ENTIRE PACKAGE FAILED DUE TO PUNCTURE OF PAIL CAUSING LIQUIDS TO SPILL OUT FROM BOTTOM OF PAIL. DescribePack: FAILED AT BOTTOM STRUCTURE OF PAIL. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.

item.title: Report E-2024020342
item.description:
Report E-2024020342

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: PLYMOUTH
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1042 ET, Schneider Bulk contacted ERTS to report a hazardous cargo release. It was reported 50-100 gallons of UN 1814 "Conquest" released due to tank overflow while the driver was performing a delivery at Zentis Food 2050 North Oak Dr, Plymouth, IN. It was reported no drains, soil or waterways were impacted. RMS arrived on site and advised 100ft by 30ft area on concrete inside the facility was impacted and migrated outside the building onto a 15ft by 20ft area of concrete. No drains or waterways were impacted. RMS utilized a pump to collect as much free standing liquid as possible, then utilize a neutralizing absorbent to clean the remaining areas. At 1505 ET, RMS advised they utilizied Chemsorb CA to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. ERTS reached out to RMS for an update. The contractor advised they have begun applying a 30% white vinegar solution to the impacted areas of the spill as the Chemsorb was not proving effective. The vinegar solution has been getting much better results and they have noted no hazardous reactions. The team sprayed the solution and then used spill pads to remove the liquid/residue. All waste was staged on site at the facility until profiled and properly disposed.
